definition: to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
to support/frame/rack/framework/classifier for planes, large vehicles, radios etc

sentences.english: In this room you can also find Aleksandr’s easel and palettes.
sentences.chinese: 在這個房間你也可以發現亞歷山大的畫架和調色板。

sentences.english: Purchase inexpensive picture frames and stack artwork in them to create a revolving show.
sentences.chinese: 買一些便宜的畫架，把畫放在上面做成旋轉的展示架。

sentences.english: A photograph of my mother sits on an easel next to the urn.
sentences.chinese: 在骨灰盒邊上有一個畫架，上面放着我母親的大照片。

sentences.english: I took it from the easel and held it up to the windows.
sentences.chinese: 我把畫從畫架上取下來，把它舉到窗戶前。

definition: lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
Long Xing Quan - "Dragon Fist" - Martial Art
the Emperor's body/Jesus' body/communion wafer (in Christian mass)
to make do in difficult circumstances by being resourceful/(of circumstances) difficult/challenging/(of a budget) tight/(of a man-made thing) makeshift/rough and ready
erhua variant of 一股腦|一股脑[yi1 gu3 nao3]
head of a flight of stairs
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation

pinyin: Shi4 jie4 Mao4 yi4 Zhong1 xin1
